pages.title: Safe people
pages.description:
In order to ensure 'Safe People' and to give confidence that users can be trusted to use the data in an appropriate manner, researchers need to be accredited by ICODA before they can access the Workbench. 
Please complete this form in order to help us achieve this. This should include education, professional qualifications and memberships that are relevant to the research project, including any up to date Information Governance training (e.g. in the UK evidence of completing the [ONS Safe User of Research data Environments] (https://www.ons.gov.uk/aboutus/whatwedo/statistics/requestingstatistics/approvedresearcherscheme) course, or the [MRC's Regulatory Support Centre Confidentiality e-learning](https://byglearning.com/mrcrsc-lms/course/index.php?categoryid=1) or internationally  [The Global Health Network's Data Sharing course](https://globalhealthtrainingcentre.tghn.org/data-sharing/)). Within a team, we would expect to see at least one qualified statistician, or someone with equivalent experience.

questions.guidance:
The application could be a new application,
                an extension,
                a renewal or amendment. For extensions or amendments,
                you must highlight the specific information within this form that has been updated,
                provide an original application number and approval date,
                any subsequent amendment approval dates and a summary of changes and rationale for the change to your original application and an updated approvals signature in order for the request to be processed.

input.label: Have you received an accreditation from ICODA

conditionalQuestions.guidance: Please add details of your existing ICODA accreditation.
conditionalQuestions.question: Reference or details of previous accreditation

options.guidance:
Please note the accreditation process will be started on the completion of this form,
                if you currently do not have accreditation.

questions.question: Have you received an accreditation from ICODA
questions.guidance:
Please note the accreditation process will be started on the completion of this form,
                if you currently do not have accreditation.
Job Title is the name of the position the applicant holds within their organisation.
questions.question: Job title
Telephone
questions.guidance:
Please include a contact telephone number,
                including international dialling code,
                the applicant can be contacted on.

questions.question: ORCID
questions.guidance:
ORCID provides a persistent digital identifier (an ORCID iD) that you own and control,
                and that distinguishes you from every other researcher. You can create an ORCID profile at q.
Please include an email address that the applicant can receive communications through.
questions.question: Email
Role on research team
questions.guidance:
The role is the function the applicant plays in the project team,
                including members accessing the secure data or who would see cleared outputs from the project (i.e. principal investigator, researcher, collaborator etc.).

questions.question: Will you access the data requested?

input.label: Will you access the data requested?

questions.guidance:
Please confirm whether the applicant will be accessing and working with the data that is being requested,
                or if you are applying on someone else's behalf.

questions.question: Please provide evidence of the team's expertise and experience relevant to delivering the project (3000 characters)

questions.guidance: Please provide legal name to appear on legal documents.
questions.question: Organisation name

questions.guidance: Please confirm sponsor organisation postcode or zipcode.
questions.question: Postcode
